result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status hearing on October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

BOND COVERS 22CF250, 22CF296, 22CF297 and 22CF369. Not to possess or consume alcohol. Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion. No abusive contact RMC 
It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations: AJC, BC, JC. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. 
No contact with SJBA, TCM, or the Woodhill Bar.

CASES 22CF250, 22CF296, 22CF297, 22CF369. 9:00 AM Defendant Abdirahman M Hassan in court.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Abdirahman M Hassan. Attorney  Benjamin Webster in court for State of Wisconsin.   AW-clerk.  Atty Firkus addresses the court. New case filed for def. 22CF369 also called. Waives reading. Def waives PH. CT finds PC. Arraignment: Waive reading and enter plea of NG.  CT-accepts plea.  Defense is preserved 15 days on Pre-argn rights. CT set bond.  9:07 am adj.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
